contents.item: In his forty-third year William Stoner learned what others, much younger, had learned before him: that the person one loves at first is not the person one loves at last, and that love is not an end but a process through which one person attempts to know another.
Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be. I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape.

We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations.
My destination is no longer a place, rather a new way of seeing.

Sometimes we know in our bones what we really need to do, but we're afraid to do it. Taking a chance and stepping beyond the safety of the world we've always known is the only way to grow, though and without risk there is no reward.
contents.owner: Wil Wheaton, Just a Geek: Unflinchingly honest tales of the search for life, love, and fulfillment beyond the Starship Enterprise

contents.item: The day is ending. It's time for something that was beautiful to turn into something else that is beautiful. Now, Let go.
Science is only a Latin word for knowledge
contents.owner: Carl Sagan, The Varieties of Scientific Experience: A Personal View of the Search for God

contents.item: Mistakes are the growing pains of wisdom.

Don't you notice that there are particular moments when you are naturally inspired to introspection? Work with them gently, for these are the moments when you can go through a powerful experience, and your whole worldview can change quickly.
When every situation which life can offer is turned to the profit of spiritual growth, no situation can really be a bad one.
Don’t follow someone else’s map. You should glean teachings from all directions, keeping true to those that bring progress yet remaining open to changes in yourself.
contents.owner: Deepak Chopra, The Book of Secrets: Unlocking the Hidden Dimensions of Your Life

contents.item: Your greatest responsibility is to live a life that nourishes your highest truth.
There is no adversity that cannot bear a gift and no gift that cannot bring adversity.
Almost every so called setback is an opportunity for growth, learning, self love, wisdom and humility
Just when you think you have it all figured out, an epiphany arrives at the higher level of one's consciousness.

There's nothing you can do about the past." "You're wrong. I can learn from it..." Tariq dug his heels into his stallion's flanks, and the horse shot forward, painting a dark smudge across the sand. "And I can make sure it never happens again!
contents.owner: Renee Ahdieh, The Wrath and the Dawn

contents.item: While there may be many things in life you wish to harvest not every seed you plant will grow.
We're all a blemished spirit full of censurable faults
contents.owner: Netiera Danise, Common Cents: How to Live a Happy Life Without Money? It's Simple, Just Live!

contents.item: Everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you're climbing it.

You can curse the moonCurse the day your’re bornBut the pilot of your plane is youWe’re all in this world, by a greater plan Look up, lift your wings, Because you canThe Light Said (The First Song album)
